Description: Defines the behaviour and complexity of V Blood Bosses. Relaxed uses simpler mechanics, Normal uses standard mechanics, and Hard (Brutal) employs more advanced mechanics and tougher behaviours.

EnumValues.0: Relaxed - Bosses will in general not use too complex mechanics
EnumValues.1: Normal - Bosses will use the default mechanics
EnumValues.2: Brutal - Bosses will use some more advanced mechanics and behaviours

Description: Defines the core ruleset for player interaction. PvE (Player vs Environment) - players cannot directly harm each other or their castles. PvP (Player vs Player) - players can engage in combat and potentially raid castles.

Defines if and when players can damage other players' castles. Only active if GameModeType is PvP. Never - castles cannot be damaged. Always - castles can always be damaged. TimeRestricted - castles can only be damaged during specific time windows.

Defines if and when players can damage other players. Only active if GameModeType is PvP. Always - players can always damage each other. TimeRestricted - players can only damage each other during specific time windows defined in PlayerInteractionSettings.

Defines the health points of Siege Golems. VeryLow (750 HP), Low (1000 HP), Normal (1250 HP), High (1750 HP), VeryHigh (2500 HP), MegaHigh (3250 HP), UltraHigh (4000 HP), CrazyHigh (5000 HP), Max (7500 HP).

Defines if and how players can destroy or seize other players' Castle Hearts. Affected by CastleDamageMode and only relevant in PvP. CanBeDestroyedOnlyWhenDecaying - only while castle is decaying. CanBeDestroyedByPlayers - can be destroyed. CanBeSeizedOrDestroyedByPlayers - can be seized or destroyed.

EnumValues.CanBeDestroyedOnlyWhenDecaying: Can Be Destroyed Only When Decaying
EnumValues.CanBeSeizedOrDestroyedByPlayers: Can Be Seized Or Destroyed By Players

Description: Defines how long a player is protected from PvP damage after spawning or respawning in PvP mode. Disabled (0 seconds), VeryShort (15 minutes), Short (30 minutes), Medium (1 hour), Long (2 hours).

Sets permission for who can loot a player's dropped inventory (Death Container) upon their death. Anyone - anyone can loot. ClanMembers - only members of the deceased's clan can loot. OnlySelf - only the owner can loot.

Defines how many Relics (Soul Shards) can exist in the world. Unique - only one of each Shard type can exist at any time, destroyed if holder dies and not recovered. Plentiful - no limit to how many of each Shard type can exist simultaneously.
Defines if players can loot storage containers (e.g., chests, workbenches) within enemy castles that they do not own. False - cannot loot enemy containers. True - can loot enemy containers.

If enabled, players will keep their equipped armor and weapons upon death. Durability loss still applies based on other settings. False - equipment is dropped in Death Container on death. True - equipped items remain on the player after death.

When enabled, carrying certain items prevents the player from using Vampire Waygates or transforming into Bat Form for travel. False - players can teleport while carrying resource items. True - carrying resource items blocks teleportation.

When enabled, carrying certain items prevents the player from transforming into Bat Form for travel. False - players can use Bat Form while carrying resource items. True - carrying resource items blocks Bat Form usage.

When enabled, carrying Soul Shards prevents the player from transforming into Bat Form for travel. False - players can use Bat Form while carrying Soul Shards. True - carrying Soul Shards blocks Bat Form usage.
Enables or disables the server-wide global chat channel. Local chat is always available. False - global chat disabled. True - global chat enabled.

If enabled, all Vampire Waygates across the map will be unlocked for all players by default, without needing discovery. False - players must discover Waygates to use them. True - all Waygates are unlocked from the start.

Defines if breaching castle defenses during permitted raid times requires materials (e.g., explosives) or is free. False - raiding requires siege materials. True - raiding does not require specific siege materials.
Defines if claiming an empty Castle Territory plot or a destroyed enemy Castle Heart requires Castle Heart materials or is free. False - claiming requires materials. True - claiming is free.

Defines if destroying an enemy Castle Heart (when permitted by other settings) requires specific actions/materials or is free. False - destroying may have requirements. True - destroying is straightforward once defenses are down.
Defines if players are allowed to use the Castle Relocation feature to move their entire castle base. False - Castle Relocation is disabled. True - Castle Relocation is enabled.
Enables or disables the entire inactivity kill feature. Used to free up server slots or prevent bases from being permanently occupied by absent players. False - disabled. True - enabled.
Minimum duration (in seconds) a player must be continuously logged out/inactive before being eligible for killing. This time applies to players at or below Item Level 1.

Maximum duration (in seconds) a player must be continuously logged out/inactive before being eligible for killing. This time applies to players at or above InactivityKillTimerMaxItemLevel. Time scales linearly between Min and Max based on item level.
Additional time (in seconds) added to the inactivity timer if the player logs out while inside their own powered castle territory (considered a safe spot).

DisplayName: Inactivity Kill Timer Max Item Level
Description: The player Item Level at which the maximum inactivity time (InactivityKillTimeMax) is applied. The time scales linearly between Min and Max based on item level below this threshold. Range: 0-255.

DisplayName: Disable Sun Damage For Disconnected Players
Description: If enabled, the vampire character of a disconnected player remains in the world vulnerable until reconnection. If false, the character becomes invulnerable/disabled after a timer. True - character remains vulnerable. False - character becomes invulnerable after timer.
If DisableDisconnectedDeadEnabled is false, this is the duration (in seconds) after disconnection before the player's character becomes disabled/invulnerable.
Duration (in seconds) a player's character is immune to sun damage immediately after disconnecting while standing in direct sunlight. Range: 0-3600 seconds.
Defines the starting progression level for new players. Default is 0. Range: 0-255. Meaningful values likely correspond to certain progression milestones.
Multiplier applied to the maximum stack size for all stackable items in player inventories and storage containers. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-3.0.
Multiplier for general loot drops from enemies, breakables, and chests in the world. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-3.0.
Multiplier for loot rewards obtained from successful Servant Hunt missions. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-3.0.
Multiplier specifically for the drop rate of Stygian Shards during Rift Incursion events. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-3.0.
Multiplier for the rate at which held Soul Shards lose durability over time. Default is 1.0. Set to 0 to disable durability loss. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the amount of resources (e.g., wood, stone, ore) gained per swing when harvesting resource nodes. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-3.0.
Multiplier for the amount of Blood Essence obtained from defeating living creatures (humans, creatures). Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-3.0.
Multiplier applied to the base respawn timer for players after being killed in PvP combat. Default is 1.0. Lower values result in faster respawns. Range: 0.0-3.0.

DisplayName: Journal VBlood Source Unit Max Distance
Description: This setting is currently unused.
Keywords: journal, vblood, source, unit, max, distance

Description: This setting is unused/broken since the introduction of Castle Territories.
Defines the maximum number of players allowed in a single clan. Range: 1-50.
Multiplier for the passive rate at which a vampire's blood pool drains over time. Default is 1.0. Higher values mean blood drains faster. Set to 0 to disable passive blood drain. Range: 0.0-3.0.

Multiplier for the rate at which equipped items (armor, weapons) lose durability from use (attacking, taking damage). Default is 1.0. Higher values mean durability is lost faster. Set to 0 to disable durability loss. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the intensity of the negative effects (damage, increased damage taken) when exposed to Garlic. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the intensity of damage taken when exposed to Holy Radiation areas. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the intensity of damage taken from carrying Silver items (coins, ore). Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for damage taken when exposed to direct Sunlight. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for how quickly a Castle Heart loses health and its structures decay when it has run out of Blood Essence. Default is 1.0. Higher values mean faster decay. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the rate at which a powered Castle Heart consumes Blood Essence to maintain its structures and prevent decay. Default is 1.0. Higher values mean faster consumption. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Duration a castle remains in the 'Breached' or vulnerable state after its defenses are initially destroyed during a raid, allowing the Castle Heart to be damaged/seized. Range: 60-1800 seconds.
Duration a castle is flagged as 'Under Attack' after taking damage from an enemy player. Range: 0-60 seconds.
Duration that castle defenses (doors, walls potentially) remain disabled or easily destroyable after the Castle Heart is damaged during a PvP raid window. Range: 60-3600 seconds.
Duration (in seconds) a castle is protected from subsequent raids after being successfully raided (e.g., Heart damaged or seized). Range: 0-604800 seconds (7 days).
Cooldown period (in seconds) after using the Castle Relocation feature before it can be used again. Range: 0-2592000 seconds (30 days).

Duration (in seconds) after a castle plot becomes abandoned (due to decay or owner deletion) that it remains claimable for free before requiring the standard material cost to claim. Range: 0-3600 seconds.
If enabled, a server-wide message announces when a player crafts a Siege Golem. False - no announcement. True - announces to all players.
If enabled, active Siege Golems will appear as icons on the map for all players. False - not shown on map. True - shown on map.
Multiplier for the material cost required to place structures, walls, floors, and other building elements in a castle. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the material cost required to craft items at various crafting structures (e.g., Smithy, Tailoring Bench, Gem Cutting Table). Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the speed at which items are crafted at crafting structures. Default is 1.0. Higher values mean faster crafting. Range: 0.25-6.0.
This setting is currently unused. Research completion is typically instant upon spending cost.
Multiplier for the cost (e.g., Paper, Scrolls, Schematics) required to unlock research and technologies at the Research Desk, Study, or Athenaeum. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the input material cost required for refining resources at refinement structures (e.g., ore into ingots at Furnace, lumber into planks at Sawmill). Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.
Multiplier for the speed at which resources are refined at refinement structures. Default is 1.0. Higher values mean faster refinement. Range: 0.25-6.0.
Multiplier determining the percentage of the original material cost returned to the player when dismantling a placed structure or object. Default is 1.0 (100%). Range: 0.0-1.0.
Multiplier for the speed at which captured humans are converted into Servants inside Servant Coffins. Default is 1.0. Higher values mean faster conversion. Range: 0.25-6.0.
Multiplier for the material cost required to repair damaged equipment at a workbench or via the inventory UI. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.0-3.0.

The percentage of maximum durability lost from equipped items when a player dies (only applies if BloodBoundEquipment is false). Default is 0.125 (12.5%). Setting to 0 disables durability loss on death. Range: 0.0-1.0.

DisplayName: Death Durability Loss Factor As Resources
Description: The percentage of the durability value lost on death that is dropped as corresponding repair materials in the Death Container, instead of just being lost durability. Default is 1.0 (100%). If set to 0, no repair resources are dropped, only durability is lost. Range: 0.0-1.0.

Defines the set of equipment players start with when first spawning in the crypt. Uses internal identifiers for equipment sets. 0=None, 742198603=Copper, -663535879=Merciless Copper, 688096336=Iron, -1502721803=Merciless Iron, 28431735=Dark Silver, -983090495=Sanguine, -1466803079=Dracula (Ancestral/End-game).

Determines a bundle of starting resources the player spawns with, often corresponding to a certain progression level. Uses internal identifiers. 0=None, 1982471388=Level 30 Supplies, 1504234317=Level 40 Supplies, 548330870=Level 50 Supplies, 815373441=Level 60 Supplies, -1370930855=Level 70 Supplies, -1394108841=Level 80 Supplies.
Multiplier for the quantity of each item available in the trader's stock per restock cycle. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-10.0.
Multiplier for the cost (in Silver Coins or other currency) of items sold by the trader. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-10.0.
Multiplier for the time it takes for the trader's inventory to fully restock. Lower values (< 1.0) mean faster restocks. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.25-10.0.

A list containing specific settings overrides for individual V Blood bosses. Allows modification of specific boss levels or making them unlocked by default. Each entry contains UnitId (boss identifier), UnitLevel (0 for default or custom level), and DefaultUnlocked (true/false for V Blood menu visibility).
Controls which Quests will automatically be granted to new players joining the server. This setting grants all preceding quest rewards up to the specified quest. Uses internal quest IDs.

Sets which tiers of research are unlocked by default for new players joining the server. Add -495424062 for Tier 1 (Research Desk), -1292809886 for Tier 2 (Study), -1262194203 for Tier 3 (Athenaeum). May only affect newly created characters.
A list of Steam64 IDs for players that are in-game admins. [Find your Steam64 ID](https://steamid.io/lookup/)
A list of Steam64 IDs for players that are banned [Find a Steam64 ID](https://steamid.io/lookup/)
The total length of a full in-game day-night cycle in real-world seconds. Range: 60-86400 seconds (24 hours).
The in-game hour (0-23) when daytime begins (sun rises). Range: 0-23.
The in-game minute (0-59) when daytime begins. Range: 0-59.
The in-game hour (0-23) when nighttime begins (sun sets). Range: 0-23.
The in-game minute (0-59) when nighttime begins. Range: 0-59.
The minimum number of full in-game days that must pass between the end of one Blood Moon and the start of the next. Range: 1-255.
The maximum number of full in-game days that can pass before a Blood Moon is guaranteed to occur (if one hasn't happened sooner due to random chance within the Min/Max window). Range: 1-255.
A multiplier affecting the strength of the stat bonuses granted to players (and potentially enemies) during a Blood Moon event. Default is 0.2 (20%). Range: 0.0-1.0.
Multiplier for base maximum health of player vampires. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for base physical power of player vampires (affects weapon damage). Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for base spell power of player vampires (affects ability damage/effectiveness). Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for the damage dealt per swing to resource nodes (trees, rocks, veins). Affects harvesting speed. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
This setting is currently unused. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for all damage taken by the player vampire from any source. Lower values (< 1.0) reduce damage taken. Default is 1.0.
The time (in seconds) a player must wait after initiating a respawn/revive action before they are allowed to cancel it. Default is 5.0.
Multiplier for the Max Health bonuses provided by equipment. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for Resource Yield bonuses provided by equipment (e.g., from Worker blood type bonus on gear). Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for the Physical Power bonuses provided by equipment. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for the Spell Power bonuses provided by equipment. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for the Siege Power bonuses provided by equipment. Default is 1.0. Range: 0.01-10.0.
This setting is currently unused. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for the base maximum health of regular Enemies (non-V Bloods). Default is 1.0. Note: Overridden by difficulty presets if not in Normal mode. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for the base power of regular Enemies (affecting damage dealt). Default is 1.0. Note: Overridden by difficulty presets if not in Normal mode. Range: 0.01-10.0.
A flat value added to the base level of regular Enemies, increasing their overall stats and difficulty. Default is 0. Range: 0-100.
Multiplier for the base maximum health of V Blood Carriers. Default is 1.0. Note: Overridden by difficulty presets if not in Normal mode. Range: 0.01-10.0.
Multiplier for the base power of V Blood Carriers (affecting damage dealt). Default is 1.0. Note: Overridden by difficulty presets if not in Normal mode. Range: 0.01-10.0.
A flat value added to the base level of V Blood Carriers, increasing their overall stats and difficulty. Default is 0. Range: 0-100.
How frequently (in seconds) the server checks Castle Heart status for Blood Essence consumption and decay processing. Range: 0.1-600 seconds.
Maximum number of Vampire Lockboxes (personal, secure storage) allowed per castle. Range: 0-20.
Maximum number of Eye of Twilight structures (used for territory visibility) allowed per castle. Range: 0-20.
Maximum number of Tombs (used for raising skeletons) allowed per castle. Range: 1-20.
Maximum number of Vermin Nests (used for spawning rats/spiders) allowed per castle. Range: 1-20.
Maximum number of Prison Cells (used for holding charmed humans) allowed per castle. Range: 0-255.
Maximum number of Castle Hearts (and thus separate castles) allowed per player or per clan, depending on CastleHeartLimitType. Range: 0-5.
Maximum number of Stygian Summoning Circles allowed per castle. Range: 0-255.
Maximum number of Throne of Darkness structures (used for Servant Hunts) allowed per castle. Range: 0-255.
The number of arena stations players may build in a single castle
The number of routing stations players may build in a single castle
Determines whether the CastleLimit setting applies individually to each User or collectively to each Clan. User - per player. Clan - per clan.
Maximum number of floor tiles allowed within the castle territory at Castle Heart Level 1. Range: 9-9999.
Maximum number of Servant Coffins (and thus controllable Servants) allowed at Castle Heart Level 1. Range: 0-35.
Maximum height in terms of wall levels (floors) allowed for castle construction at Castle Heart Level 1. Range: 0-255.
Maximum number of floor tiles allowed within the castle territory at Castle Heart Level 2. Range: 9-9999.
Maximum number of Servant Coffins (and thus controllable Servants) allowed at Castle Heart Level 2. Range: 0-35.
Maximum height in terms of wall levels (floors) allowed for castle construction at Castle Heart Level 2. Range: 0-255.
Maximum number of floor tiles allowed within the castle territory at Castle Heart Level 3. Range: 9-9999.
Maximum number of Servant Coffins (and thus controllable Servants) allowed at Castle Heart Level 3. Range: 0-35.
Maximum height in terms of wall levels (floors) allowed for castle construction at Castle Heart Level 3. Range: 0-255.
Maximum number of floor tiles allowed within the castle territory at Castle Heart Level 4. Range: 9-9999.
Maximum number of Servant Coffins (and thus controllable Servants) allowed at Castle Heart Level 4. Range: 0-35.
Maximum height in terms of wall levels (floors) allowed for castle construction at Castle Heart Level 4. Range: 0-255.
Maximum number of floor tiles allowed within the castle territory at Castle Heart Level 5. Range: 9-9999.
Maximum number of Servant Coffins (and thus controllable Servants) allowed at Castle Heart Level 5. Range: 0-35.
Maximum height in terms of wall levels (floors) allowed for castle construction at Castle Heart Level 5. Range: 0-255.
Specifies the time zone the server uses for calculating the start and end times of PvP and Castle raid windows. Options: Local (server time zone), UTC, PST, EST, CET, CST (China Standard Time).
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Player vs Player damage window begins on weekdays (Monday-Friday). Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Player vs Player damage window begins on weekdays. Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Player vs Player damage window ends on weekdays. Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Player vs Player damage window ends on weekdays. Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Player vs Player damage window begins on weekends (Saturday-Sunday). Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Player vs Player damage window begins on weekends. Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Player vs Player damage window ends on weekends. Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Player vs Player damage window ends on weekends. Used when PlayerDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Castle damage (raiding) window begins on weekdays. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Castle damage window begins on weekdays. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Castle damage window ends on weekdays. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Castle damage window ends on weekdays. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Castle damage window begins on weekends. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Castle damage window begins on weekends. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.
The hour (in 24-hour format) when the Castle damage window ends on weekends. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-23.
The minute when the Castle damage window ends on weekends. Used when CastleDamageMode is set to TimeRestricted. Range: 0-59.

Defines the approximate time duration between the start of consecutive war events (Rift Incursions). Values: 0=Minimum (30 min), 1=VeryShort (1 hr), 2=Short (1.5 hrs), 3=Medium (2 hrs), 4=Long (4 hrs), 5=VeryLong (8 hrs), 6=Extensive (12 hrs), 7=Maximum (24 hrs).

Defines the duration of Major war events (Major Rift Incursions). Values: 0=Minimum (15 min), 1=VeryShort (20 min), 2=Short (25 min), 3=Medium (30 min), 4=Long (35 min), 5=VeryLong (45 min), 6=Extensive (1 hr), 7=Maximum (2 hrs).

Defines the duration of Minor war events (Minor Rift Incursions). Values: 0=Minimum (15 min), 1=VeryShort (20 min), 2=Short (25 min), 3=Medium (30 min), 4=Long (35 min), 5=VeryLong (45 min), 6=Extensive (1 hr), 7=Maximum (2 hrs).
The hour when war events (Rift Incursions) are allowed to spawn during weekdays. Range: 0-23.
The minute when war events are allowed to spawn during weekdays. Range: 0-59.
The hour when war events stop spawning during weekdays. Range: 0-23.
The minute when war events stop spawning during weekdays. Range: 0-59.
The hour when war events are allowed to spawn during weekends. Range: 0-23.
The minute when war events are allowed to spawn during weekends. Range: 0-59.
The hour when war events stop spawning during weekends. Range: 0-23.
The minute when war events stop spawning during weekends. Range: 0-59.

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 1 Points Modifier
Description: Multiplier for points earned during war events when 1 player is participating. Affects scaling for solo play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 1, points, modifier

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 1 Drop Modifier
Description: Multiplier for loot drops during war events when 1 player is participating. Affects scaling for solo play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 1, drop, modifier

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 2 Points Modifier
Description: Multiplier for points earned during war events when 2 players are participating. Affects scaling for duo play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 2, points, modifier

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 2 Drop Modifier
Description: Multiplier for loot drops during war events when 2 players are participating. Affects scaling for duo play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 2, drop, modifier

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 3 Points Modifier
Description: Multiplier for points earned during war events when 3 players are participating. Affects scaling for trio play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 3, points, modifier

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 3 Drop Modifier
Description: Multiplier for loot drops during war events when 3 players are participating. Affects scaling for trio play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 3, drop, modifier

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 4 Points Modifier
Description: Multiplier for points earned during war events when 4 players are participating. Affects scaling for squad play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 4, points, modifier

DisplayName: War Event Scaling Players 4 Drop Modifier
Description: Multiplier for loot drops during war events when 4 players are participating. Affects scaling for squad play.
Keywords: war, event, scaling, players, 4, drop, modifier

Description: Whatever you want to name your server as
Short description of server purpose, rules, message of the day
UDP port for game traffic
UDP port for Steam server list features
TCP port for RCON
RCON Enabled to allow Console input
Use this setting for a server without internet connectivity. The LAN Mode check box must also be checked in-game when connecting.
Max number of concurrent players on server
Max number of admins to allow connect even when server is full
Target FPS for server.
Run the server at a lower framerate target when no players are logged in. Requires v1.0 or higher.
Set the framerate target for when Lower FPS When Empty is active. Requires v1.0 or higher.
Name of save file/directory
Set a password or leave empty
See the Security and Privacy menu for configurable options for the server's RCON
Choose if you want your server to use VAC or not.
Set to true to list on Steam's server list
Set to true to list on the in-game server list
Number of autosaves to keep
Interval in seconds between each auto save
Compress save files to save space
Change Game Mode Ruleset, any custom settings will be ignored if not set to Custom.  Must Match Game Mode Type.
Load a Game Difficulty preset, or set to Custom to use custom settings. Using a preset will override other custom settings!
Show debug events only to admins
Disable Debug Events from appearing at all
Enables API access (Undocumented feature)
Sets the server release stream to install. Note: Update the server after changing this setting

If set, BepInEx will be installed when the server is updated and enabled when the server is run, allowing the server to be modded. Configure "BepInEx Version" accordingly. Mods must be installed in the BepInEx/plugins directory, which is created after BepInEx is first run. Requires Wine 8 staging build on Linux (and Xvfb and cabextract)
Sets the [BepInEx version](https://thunderstore.io/c/v-rising/p/BepInEx/BepInExPack_V_Rising/versions/) to install. Empty = latest. NOTE: Update the server after switching versions!
